summary: This document contains alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting his status as a registered sex offender and detailing various legal issues and convictions related to sex offenses, fraud, and theft. It includes multiple entries about Epstein's criminal history and regulatory actions against him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a registered sex offender and has a history of multiple convictions related to sex offenses, fraud, and theft. He is mentioned throughout the document in relation to various legal alerts.

events.title: Sex Offender Registration
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein appears on the New York Sex Offenders site.

events.title: Release from Prison
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is released after serving less than 13 months of his 18-month sentence for procuring a minor for prostitution.

events.title: FINRA Disciplinary Action
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is suspended from association with any FINRA member for 10 business days due to exercising discretion in a customer's account without authorization.

events.title: Stock Exchange Arbitration Decision
events.description: A disciplinary action results in Jeffrey Epstein being ordered to pay a claimant $736.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a registered sex offender since 2008.
He has multiple convictions related to soliciting prostitution and sexual offenses against minors.
Epstein has made 17 out-of-court settlements related to sexual abuse claims.
He was convicted of postal fraud for stealing his neighbor's mail in 2006.
Epstein was suspended from FINRA for exercising discretion in a customer's account without authorization.
